sentences.english: The glory of his country is his ambition.
It is a kind of strong penetration of the automotive paint protection film.
sentences.chinese: 是一種具有強力滲透的汽車漆面增光保護膜。

sentences.english: I'll add colors and honors to your company by bringing my wisdom and ability into full play.
sentences.chinese: 我將充分發揮自己的聰明才能，爲貴公司增光添彩。

sentences.english: We are grateful to you for gracing our party with your presence.
sentences.chinese: 我們很感激你的光臨，使我們的聚會增光不少。

sentences.english: The glory of his country was his ambition .
Realize that your references are very important in essays. They even lend credibility to your research.
sentences.chinese: 論文的參考文獻很重要，甚至能爲你的課題增光添彩。

sentences.english: I would like to thank them on behalf of the UK Government.
sentences.chinese: 我應該代表英國政府感謝他們爲國增光。

sentences.english: We want them to be ambassadors for their country," the minister added.
sentences.chinese: 他鼓勵球迷們在“狂歡”的同時“爲國增光”。

sentences.english: Some beauty care products and soaps contain chemicals that make skin lighter.
sentences.chinese: 一些美麗化妝用品和藥皂含增光的化學藥劑。

sentences.english: Mr Corzine needs some of Mr Obama’s popularity to rub off on him.
sentences.chinese: Corzine需要借奧巴馬的知名度爲自己增光。

sentences.english: He urged them to " do their country proud " while encouraging them to have a "great time".
sentences.chinese: 他鼓勵球迷們在“狂歡”的同時“爲國增光”。

sentences.english: A tree covered with tinsel and gaudy paper chains graced one corner.
sentences.chinese: 一棵覆蓋着金屬絲和紙鏈的樹讓角落增光。

sentences.english: A friend will add beauty to your life, like a sweet scented flower.
sentences.chinese: 朋友就像芬芳怡人的鮮花，總會爲你的生活增光添彩。

sentences.english: The sisters are framed against a wall that adds color and light to the scene.
sentences.chinese: 修女們所處的背景是一面給整個場景增光添彩的牆。

definition: to win an honor/to strive to win a prize
lit. contribute bricks and tiles for a building (idiom)/fig. to do one's bit to help
to bring honor to one's ancestors
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to have qualified successors to carry on one's undertaking
to regard it as an honor (idiom)
to bring honor to one's ancestors (idiom)/also written 光宗耀祖
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
lit. when you drink water, think of its source (idiom); gratitude for blessings and their well-spring/Don't forget where your happiness come from./Be grateful for all your blessings!
